summary: This document is the Plaintiff's responses and objections to the first set of interrogatories from the defendants (the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate) in a civil lawsuit. The plaintiff, an unnamed victim, alleges sexual assault, battery, false imprisonment, and intentional infliction of emotional distress by Jeffrey Epstein, with Ghislaine Maxwell also implicated. The responses detail objections to discovery requests and provide limited information about the alleged abuse. This document contains Plaintiff Annie Farmer's responses and objections to interrogatories in litigation against the estate of Jeffrey Epstein and others. It details items and services she received from Epstein and includes verification and certificate of service sections identifying legal counsel.

persons.context: Referred to as 'Decedent.' The plaintiff alleges he sexually assaulted her, committed forcible touching, battery, false imprisonment, and intentional infliction of emotional distress at his properties in New York and New Mexico.

events.title: Alleged Sexual Assaults by Epstein
events.description: The plaintiff alleges Jeffrey Epstein sexually assaulted her, touching her body without consent in a movie theater in New York, a movie theater in New Mexico, and at his home in New Mexico.

events.title: Plaintiff's Rule 26 Disclosures
events.description: The plaintiff references her initial disclosures provided to the defendants, which contained information about persons with knowledge of the litigation.

events.title: Service of Defendants' Interrogatories
events.description: The defendants served their First Set of Interrogatories on the plaintiff, prompting this response document.

events.title: Filing of Interrogatory Responses
events.description: Plaintiff Annie Farmer files her verified responses and objections to defendants' first set of interrogatories.

keyFacts: The plaintiff alleges Jeffrey Epstein sexually assaulted her in multiple locations: a movie theater in New York, a movie theater in New Mexico, and at his home in New Mexico.
The plaintiff states that Ghislaine Maxwell also committed sexual offenses against her and is a person with knowledge of Epstein's alleged assaults.
The plaintiff identifies members of Epstein's house staff at his New York and New Mexico properties as individuals she may have communicated with.
The document reveals the plaintiff is pursuing claims of battery, false imprisonment, and intentional infliction of emotional distress against Epstein's estate.
The plaintiff's responses are heavily redacted, with key names of other potential witnesses and medical providers omitted, indicating the use of a protective order.
Plaintiff Annie Farmer received specific items and services from Jeffrey Epstein, including a Broadway show ticket, cowboy boots, an educational trip to Mexico, and a flight to New York City.
The document is part of ongoing litigation involving Epstein's estate, with defendants including Darren K. Indyke, Richard D. Kahn, and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The interrogatory responses were served electronically to the attorneys for all defendants on April 16, 2020.
Annie Farmer verified the interrogatory answers under penalty of perjury.
The document references a protective order governing the confidentiality of certain paragraphs.
